title: AI & ML: Machine Learning Pipelines and Model Development – 40 MCQs

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Machine Learning Pipeline?
questions.option_a: A. To write code in a linear fashion
questions.option_b: B. To automate and streamline the flow from raw data to deployed predictions
questions.option_c: C. To replace the need for data scientists
questions.option_d: D. To exclusively handle big data
questions.explanation: An ML pipeline automates and streamlines the process from data collection to deployment.

questions.question: Which of the following is the FIRST key stage in a standard ML pipeline?
questions.explanation: The first step of a pipeline is data collection from various sources.

questions.question: The stage of 'Problem Definition' primarily involves:
questions.option_a: A. Understanding the domain and business objective
questions.option_b: B. Writing the final production code
questions.option_c: C. Determining the type of ML task (e.g., classification, regression)
questions.explanation: Problem Definition includes domain understanding, identifying business objectives, and task type.

questions.question: Data stored in a CSV file with clear rows and columns is an example of:
questions.explanation: Structured data is in tabular format, e.g., CSV files.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common technique for handling missing numerical data?
questions.option_b: B. Filling with the mean value
questions.explanation: Filling with the mean is a standard way of handling missing numerical data.

questions.question: The process of converting categorical text labels into numerical values is known as:
questions.explanation: Encoding converts categorical variables into numeric form.

questions.question: You have a categorical feature 'Size' with values 'Small', 'Medium', 'Large'. Which encoding is most appropriate?
questions.explanation: Label Encoding works best for ordinal features with a meaningful order.

questions.question: You have a categorical feature 'Country' with over 100 unique values. Which encoding method is suitable?
questions.explanation: Target Encoding is efficient for high-cardinality features.

questions.question: Why is feature scaling important?
questions.option_a: A. To remove all missing values
questions.option_b: B. To ensure all features are treated equally by the model
questions.option_c: C. To convert text categories into numbers
questions.option_d: D. To select the most important features
questions.explanation: Scaling ensures that features with large values don’t dominate model training.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of dirty data?
questions.explanation: Dirty data is incomplete, noisy, or inconsistent.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Feature Engineering?
questions.option_b: B. To transform raw data into meaningful features that improve model performance
questions.option_c: C. To select the final model
questions.explanation: Feature Engineering makes raw data useful for ML models.

questions.question: In a student dataset, the 'Result' column (Pass/Fail) is known as:
questions.explanation: The variable to be predicted is called the target.

questions.question: The Variance Threshold feature selection method removes features based on:
questions.explanation: Low variance features carry little information.

questions.question: Why is Mutual Information preferred over correlation?
questions.option_b: B. Captures any dependency, not just linear
questions.explanation: Mutual Information captures linear and non-linear dependencies.

questions.question: The SelectKBest method:
questions.option_a: A. Uses a model to determine importance
questions.option_b: B. Selects top K features using statistical tests
questions.explanation: SelectKBest ranks features based on univariate statistical tests.

questions.question: Which feature selection method uses .feature_importances_ from trained models?
questions.explanation: Tree-based models can rank features by importance.

questions.question: Wrapper methods are feature selection methods that:
questions.option_b: B. Evaluate subsets with predictive models
questions.explanation: Wrapper methods test subsets using model performance.

questions.question: Lasso Regression (L1) is an example of:
questions.explanation: Lasso integrates feature selection into training.

questions.question: The primary goal of Dimensionality Reduction is to:
questions.option_b: B. Create combined features that reduce complexity
questions.explanation: PCA combines features into fewer dimensions.

questions.question: Feature Selection vs Dimensionality Reduction: which statement is correct?
questions.option_a: A. Feature Selection creates new features
questions.option_b: B. Feature Selection retains original names; Dimensionality Reduction transforms features
questions.option_c: C. Dimensionality Reduction only for classification
questions.explanation: Feature Selection keeps original features; Dimensionality Reduction produces new combinations.

questions.question: The typical split for training data is:
questions.explanation: 80% training and 20% testing is common.

questions.question: A setting defined before training and not learned from data is called:
questions.explanation: Hyperparameters are set before training, unlike parameters.

questions.question: Which is a hyperparameter for Decision Trees?
questions.explanation: max_depth controls tree size and is set before training.

questions.question: Grid Search tuning method:
questions.option_b: B. Tries all combinations of values
questions.explanation: Grid Search exhaustively tests all parameter combinations.

questions.question: The purpose of K-Fold Cross-Validation is:
questions.explanation: K-Fold tests model performance across multiple data splits.

questions.question: A model that performs well on training but poorly on test data is:
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model memorizes training data.

questions.question: A model that performs poorly on both training and test data is:
questions.explanation: Underfitting indicates the model is too simple to learn patterns.

questions.question: Which can help fix overfitting?
questions.explanation: Simpler models, regularization, and more data reduce overfitting.

questions.question: Which can help fix underfitting?
questions.explanation: Complex models and reducing regularization improve underfitting.

questions.question: Which metric is most appropriate for regression models?
questions.explanation: MAE measures prediction error for regression tasks.

questions.question: The final step of the ML pipeline is:
questions.explanation: Deployment makes the model usable in real-world scenarios.

questions.question: A common file format for saving a trained model is:
questions.explanation: Models are saved using formats like .pkl, .joblib, or .h5.

questions.question: After deployment, it is crucial to:
questions.option_b: B. Monitor and retrain with new data
questions.explanation: Continuous monitoring ensures model reliability in production.

questions.question: Which CV technique is useful for imbalanced datasets?
questions.explanation: Stratified K-Fold preserves class distribution in folds.

questions.question: The problem of a model learning noise from training data is:
questions.explanation: Overfitting means memorizing noise instead of generalizing.

questions.question: Which is a common metric for binary classification?
questions.explanation: Accuracy is widely used for binary classification tasks.

questions.question: The process of applying a penalty to prevent overfitting is called:
questions.explanation: Regularization penalizes large weights, reducing overfitting.

questions.question: The main purpose of splitting into train/test sets is:
questions.option_b: B. Evaluate model on unseen data
questions.explanation: Test sets simulate unseen data performance.

questions.question: Which stage involves creating new input features?
questions.explanation: Feature Engineering creates new features to improve learning.

questions.question: A predictive model classifying emails as spam/not spam is:
questions.explanation: Spam detection is a binary classification problem.
